title: 616-E
statement: E. Sum of Remainderstime limit per test2 secondsmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputCalculate the value of the sum:nmod1+nmod2+nmod3+ ... +nmodm. As the result can be very large, you should print the value modulo109+ 7(the remainder when divided by109+ 7).The modulo operatoramodbstands for the remainder after dividingabyb. For example10mod3=1.InputThe only line contains two integersn,m(1 ≤n,m≤ 1013) — the parameters of the sum.OutputPrint integers— the value of the required sum modulo109+ 7.ExamplesInput3 4Output4Input4 4Output1Input1 1Output0

processed.result: Given two numbers, find the sum of the remainders when the first number is divided by each number from 1 to the second number.  Print the result after dividing by a large number (10^9 + 7).

You are given two integers, $n$ and $m$ (where $1 \le n, m \le 10^{13}$).  Calculate the sum:

 $$n \mod 1 + n \mod 2 + n \mod 3 + ... + n \mod m$$

The result can be very large, so print the sum modulo $10^9 + 7$ (the remainder when the sum is divided by $10^9 + 7$).

For example, $10 \mod 3 = 1$.
